intro: Adenanthos intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate adenanthos, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and woodland environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Adenanthos intermedius is known for its seasonal flowering, which usually occurs in spring, attracting various pollinators.
